page.title: 05THE SPINNING WHEEL
page.content: The Spinning Wheel is our local { {swimming pool.}It is an open-air deep water pool(max.depth 2 metres). It is 25 metres long and ten metres wide. The water is heated, when needed, to a temperature of 80 degrees fahrenheit. By the mainpool is a toddlers pool. There is a large grassy area near the pool for people to have picnics or sunbath. There are changing rooms for males and females. These are kept clean by the lifeguards, as is the pool and the poolside. The water is kept clean by being backwashed, it is never changed. There is a ticket office, storerooms, tuckshop and a managers office. There are always lifeguards on duty when the pool is open. The pool is open from late April to early September. The pool was named after a gaming club which is now a Citizens Advice Bureau.
